radiographic_examinations.findings: Severe hyperostosis mainly affecting the skull and mandible; calvarium thickness up to 3.3 cm; extensive sclerosis and hyperostosis of the petrous bones, orbital walls, and calvarium; loss of diploe due to cortical thickening; constriction of the temporomandibular joint and foramina affecting cranial nerves.

Irregular brain surface shape; expanded sella turcica; flattened pituitary gland; elongated pituitary stalk; signs of increased intracranial pressure, including distention of optic nerve sheaths, depletion of subarachnoid space, and herniation of cerebellar tonsils.
